Class CritterHome

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • CritterHome
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CritterHome
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    The CritterHome class is the class that creates the home of the Critter which has a critter.
    Version:
    3 05.29.15

    name: Critter Home.java

    Instance variables:

    userName This String variable is used to save the user's name.

    critterColour This String variable is used to store the selected critter colour.

    points This int variable is used to store the number of points of the user.

    difficulty This int variable is used to store the user's selected difficulty level.

    selectedIndex The int variable of the index of the food item's location in the fridge.

    day This int variable is used to store the virtual day number.

    hour This int variable is used to store the virtual hour number.

    minute This int variable is used to store the virtual minute number.

    leaveDialog This creates an instance of the JDialog class for displaying a menu of choices to the user for where they want to navigate to.

    fridgeDialog This int variable is used to store the user's choice when they click on the fridge's food.

    hoverDoor This boolean variable to store whether the user's mouse entered the picture of the door or not.

    hoverCritter This boolean variable to store whether the user's mouse entered the picture of the critter or not.

    hoverCalendar This boolean variable to store whether the user's mouse entered the picture of the calendar or not.

    eaten This boolean variable to store whether the critter just ate something or not.

    fridge An ArrayList of Food objects in the fridge.

    selectedItem The Food object that the user selected from their fridge.

    storeButton This creates an instance of the JButton class with the string title "GroceryStore" passed in.

    recButton This creates an instance of the JButton class with the string title "Play Outside" passed in.

    menuButton This creates an instance of the JButton class with the string title "Main Menu" passed in.

    docButton This creates an instance of the JButton class with the string title "Doctor" passed in.

    infoButton This creates an instance of the JButton class with the string title "Pamphlet" passed in.

    myCritter This creates an instance of the Critter class.

    clock This creates an instance of the Timer class.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou and Laura Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CritterHome

        public CritterHome(java.lang.String userName,
                   int difficulty,
                   java.lang.String critterColour)
        The CritterHome constructor creates a CritterHome with the specified userName, difficulty and critterColour. It adds a MouseListener and a MouseMotionListener to the JPanel and sets the layout to null. The Timer, clock, has an ActionListener that increments time in minutes and hours. The first if statement checks if minute is 59. If so, hour is incremented, else, minute is incremented. The clock is started.
        Parameters:
        userName - This String variable is used to save the user's name.
        difficulty - This int variable is used to store the user's difficulty level.
        critterColour - This String variable is used to store the critter's colour.

        Parameters:

      • addFood

        public void addFood(Food food,
                    int quantity)
        The addFood method adds food to the fridge by quantity and repaints the fridge graphics. The for loop starts from 0, runs while less than quantity and increments by one each in order to add the correct amount of the food Object to the fridge.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        x The integer for loop variable that starts from 0, runs while less than quantity and increments by one each in order to add the correct amount of the food Object to the fridge.

        Parameters:
        food - is the Food object to be added to the fridge
        quantity - is the integer amount of the Food object to be added to the fridge.

      • handleFridgeDialog

        public void handleFridgeDialog()
        The handleFridgeDialog method handles the user's choice in the fridge dialog. The first if statement checks if the user did not close the dialog. If true, the next if statement checks if the user chose to feed their critter. If true, the next if statement checks if the critter is too full to eat more food, which means that the nutrient value of the food and the critter's fullness level exceeds 10. If true, a JOptionPane tells the user that the critter is too full to eat anymore. Else, the food is added to the stomach is eaten is set to true. The next if statement checks if eaten is true or if the user chose to throw out the food. If true, the food will be removed from the fridge and repaint the graphics.

      • fullnessBar

        public void fullnessBar(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The fullnessBar method displays the bar that represents how full the critter is per meal.
        Parameters:
        g - is the Graphics class to be used to display graphics.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        The mouseClicked method listens for a mouse release. The for loop starts from 0, runs while less than the size of the fridge times 63 and increments by 63 each time. That for loop is for checking through every icon in the fridge. The first if statement checks if the user clicked one of the food icons. If true, the selectedItem and selectedIndex variables are assigned according to the Food item clicked. Then the fridgeDialog is shown to ask if the user wants to feed or throw out the food. The next if statement checks if the user clicked on the door. If true, the leaveDialog asks the user where they want to go by showing a menu of options to choose from.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        fridgeOptions [] Object of the options of the fridgeDialog.

        col The integer loop variable that starts from 0, runs while less than the size of the fridge times 63 and increments by 63 each time.

        options [] An array of instances of the JButton class for the options of the leaveDialog.

        leaveOptionPane An instance of the JOptionPane that asks the user where they want to go.

        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent that stores the user's mouse actions.

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        The mouseMoved method listens for a mouse movement. The first if statement checks if the user hovered over the door and if true, sets hoverDoor to true, else, false. The first if statement checks if the user hovered over the critter and if true, sets hoverCritter to true, else, false. The first if statement checks if the user hovered over the calendar and if true, sets hoverCalendar to true, else, false.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent that stores the user's mouse actions.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the graphics on to the JPanel If hoverDoor is true, the door is drawn with a glowing edge. If hoverCritter is true, the speech bubble is drawn. If hoverCalendar is true, the schedule is drawn. If eaten is true and the user chooses to feed the critter in the fridgeDialog, the speech bubble displays the food eaten. If minute has one digit, a leading zero image is drawn before the corresponding minute image. Else, both minute digits are displayed with the correct image numbers If hour has one digit, a leading zero image is drawn before the corresponding hour image. Else, both hour digits are displayed with the correct image numbers The for loop starts from 0, runs while less than the amount of food in the fridge and increments by one each time.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        x The integer loop variable that starts from 0, runs while less than the amount of food in the fridge and increments by one each time in order to display all the food in the fridge.

        speechBubble This creates an instance of the Image class to store the image of the speech bubble.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
